alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 28 at 1:24PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Coastal flooding caused by high surf continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Monterey. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 122 PM PST, Gauge reports indicated minor rises in water levels at the Carmel Lagoon with the current level at 11.9 feet. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carmel-By-The-Sea. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
